summary: This document is an email chain from March 2019 regarding the logistics of transferring and uploading digital evidence (a hard drive and discs) related to the US v. Epstein investigation. It involves coordination between an Assistant United States Attorney and others to have the FBI case agent provide data for upload to a shared drive.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Coordinates the logistics of uploading FBI data on the Epstein case to a shared drive, copied on the email chain.

events.title: Hard Drive and Discs Upload
events.description: Materials from a hard drive and a number of discs were uploaded to specific shared directories for the US v. Epstein investigation.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Digital evidence (a hard drive and discs) related to the Epstein investigation was uploaded to shared directories on March 6, 2019.
The FBI possessed a large amount of data on the Epstein case that needed to be coordinated for upload by the case agent.
The correspondence involves an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York facilitating the evidence transfer.
